etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French astrologie, from Latin astrologia, from Greek, from astron ‘star’

definitions: the study of the movements and relative positions of celestial bodies interpreted as having an influence on human affairs and the natural world.

notes.text: Ancient observers of the heavens developed elaborate systems of explanation based on the movements of the sun, moon, and planets through the constellations of the zodiac, for predicting events and for casting horoscopes. By 1700 astrology had lost intellectual credibility in the West, but continued to have popular appeal. Modern astrology is based on that of the Greeks, but other systems are extant, notably those of China and India

shortDefinitions: study of movements and relative positions of celestial bodies interpreted as having influence on human affairs
